For the past few months, I've been collecting data on my gym schedule to see if what workouts I do change my sleep schedule (in hours). I hypothesize that on leg days, I will sleep for more hours.

```{r, message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(ggridges)
library(PNWColors)
library(gt)
```

### data table

```{r,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,echo=FALSE}
stat_data <- read.csv("STATS workout data - Sheet1-4.csv") |> 
  clean_names() |> 
  rename(day = day_of_the_week, time = time_of_day_of_workout) |> 
  filter(exercise_type != "Sarms")

clean_data <- stat_data %>%
  mutate(exercise_type = na_if(exercise_type, "")) %>%
  drop_na(exercise_type)

gt(clean_data)

ggplot(clean_data, 
aes(x = asleep, y = exercise_type, fill = exercise_type)) +
geom_density_ridges() +
theme_ridges() + 
theme(legend.position = "none",
      axis.title = element_text(color = "#00496FFF"), 
      axis.line = element_line(color = "#00496FFF"), 
      axis.text = element_text(color = "#00496FFF"), 
      axis.ticks = element_line(color = "#00496FFF"),
      plot.title = element_text(color = "#DD4124FF"))+
scale_fill_manual(values = PNWColors::pnw_palette("Bay", 5))+
labs(x = "Sleep (Hours)",
y = "Exercise",
title = "Workout Plot",
caption = "Evan's Gym Plot")
```

### the averages

Below are the average hours of sleep for each exercise.

**Push**

```{r, echo=FALSE}
mean(clean_data$asleep[clean_data$exercise_type == "Push"], na.rm = TRUE)#mean push
```

**Pull**

```{r,echo=FALSE}
mean(clean_data$asleep[clean_data$exercise_type == "Pull"], na.rm = TRUE)#mean pull
```

**Legs**

```{r,echo=FALSE}
mean(clean_data$asleep[clean_data$exercise_type == "Legs"], na.rm = TRUE)#mean legs
```

**Rest**

```{r,echo=FALSE}
mean(clean_data$asleep[clean_data$exercise_type == "Rest"], na.rm = TRUE)
```
